oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BEACH RESPONSE TO VARIATIONS IN BREAKER HEIGHT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Short, A.D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach response
breaker height
breaking waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The breaker wave height required to produce a particular beach-surfzone morphology is examined for micro-tidal, medium to fine sand beaches. Waves >2.5m produce dissipative beach systems with wide surfzones and shore parallel bar/s and channel/s. Breakers between 1 and 2.5m result in rip circulation and associated rhythmic morphology (crescentic bars, rip channels, megacusps, etc). Low waves (
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 17 (1980): Proceedings of 17th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 1980.; 62
